function.description: Inside IF we will use AND condition. performs a logical conjunction on two expressions. In 'column' paramter we will 'drag column'. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,like). In 'value' parameter provide condition value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR' condition , 'AND' conditions. Example: CASE WHEN 'Washington' like '%sh%' AND 'Washington' like 'W%' THEN 'return washington' else 'NotMatched' end

Inside case we will use when condition. Evaluates each condition from left to right and returns the result when the first condition met. If no condition met return from else if exist, otherwise return null. Example : CASE WHEN Quantity > 30 THEN "The quantity is greater than 30" ELSE "The quantity is under 30" END
Returns from statement_list when condition gets fail.We will use ELSE inside case function. Example: CASE when 50 > 0 then 'true' else 'false'

function.signature: (case when ${column} ${condition} ${value} then ${conditiontrue} when ${elseIfcolumn} ${elseIfcondition} ${elseIfvalue} then ${elseIfconditiontrue} else ${conditionfalse} ${moreconditions} end)
function.description: Evaluates conditions and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. We will use nested condition inside else 'conditiontrue' parameter. Example:case when creditlim > 50000 then 'PLATINUM' else when (creditlim > = 50000) then 'GOLD' else 'SILVER' end

Inside IF we will use AND, OR conditions. Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. In 'column' paramter we will drag column. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR', 'AND' conditions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0 (Note : In such case don't provide anything in 'condition' parameter and 'value' parameter). Example : (Case when (creditlim > 50000) then 'PLATINUM' else 'SILVER' end)
Returns Expr1 if it is not null otherwise return expr2. Example : IFNULL(profit, '0')
Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. Example : case when 'washington'like 'W%' then 'true' else 'false' end

Inside WHEN condition we will use ISNULL. Evalutes and returns 'Conditiontrue' if the expression contain Null. Example1 : CASE WHEN 1 ISNULL THEN Conditionfalse. Example2 : CASE WHEN NULL ISNULL THEN Conditiontrue
Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is false, otherwise returns 'conditionfalse'. We will use NOT inside IF. Example : NOT(500 > 1000) result :true

Performs a logical disjunction on two expressions. In 'column' paramter we will drag column. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR' , 'AND' functions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0 in such case don't provide anything in 'condition' and 'value' parameter. We will use OR inside IF. Example : CASE WHEN 'Washington' like '%sh%' OR 'Washington' like 'W%' THEN 'return washington' else 'NotMatched' end

Returns 'statement_list' when condition get satisfied . In column paramter we will drag column. In searchcondition parameter provide conditions like (>, =, IS Null etc .,). In value parameter provide value(Note : IS Null used in 'condition' parameter then don't provide anything in 'value' parameter). In moreconditions parameter we will use nested when conditions, Else condition . We will use WHEN inside CASE. Example1 : CASE WHEN 1 > 0 THEN 'one' else 'TWO'. Example2 : CASE WHEN 'Singapore' IS NULL THEN 'Singa' ELSE 'pore'. Example3 : CASE WHEN Washington like '%sh%' THEN 'return washington' else 'NotMatched'

function.signature: (CASE WHEN ${expr} IS NULL THEN '0' ELSE ${expr} end)
function.description: Returns "expression" if it is not null, otherwise returns zero.Example :ZN(null) result :0
Returns the Unicode of the first character of string. Example:ASCII('A') - 65
Returns the character encoded by the ASCII code.Example:CHAR(65) - A
Returns the concatenation of string1, string2.Example : CONCAT('Beng','aluru') result : Bengaluru
Returns true if the given string contains the specified substring. Example : case when (instr('aluru', 'Bengaluru')> 0 then 1 else 0 end result:1

function.signature: case when(${string} like concat('%',${substring})) then 'true' else 'false' end
function.description: Returns true if the given string endswith specified substring. Example:case when('postgres' like concat('%','res')) then true else false end result: true. Note:Please provide single quotes if you are directly typing the substring value.

function.signature: case when(${string} like concat(${substring},'%')) then 'true' else 'false' end
function.description: Returns true if string starts with substring. Example: case when('bengaluru' like concat('ben','%')) then true else false end result: true. Note:Please provide single quotes if you are directly typing the substring value.

Returns the starting position of the first instance of substring in string. Positions start with 1. If not found, 0 is returned. Example :instr('z','Bengaluru') result : 0, instr('aluru','Bengaluru') result : 5
Returns the position of nth occurrence of given substring in a string. Example:instr('calculation','a',1, 2).Result:7
Returns the left most character from the string. If length is more than string it will return entire string. Note: Array index starts with 1. Example: substr('bengaluru', 1, 4) result: 'beng'
Returns the number of characters in string. Example : LENGTH('Bengaluru') result:9
Converts all characters in the specified string to lowercase. Example: LOWER('BENGALURU') result: bengaluru

Displays a string that is left padded with a specified string to a certain length. If length is less than the length of string, the result is truncated to length characters. Length must not be negative and padString must not be non-empty. Example : LPAD('Wellesley', 14,'Hills') result: HillsWellesley

Displays a string that is right-padded with a specified string to a certain length. If length is less than the length of string, the result is truncated to length characters. Length must not be negative and padString must not be non-empty. Example : Rpad('Wellesley', 15, 'Hills') result : Wellesley Hills
Returns string with the characters in reverse order. Example : REVERSE('Bengaluru') result :urulagneB
Removes leading whitespace from string. Example : LTRIM(' Bengaluru') result: Bengaluru
Returns the string, starting at start_position. The first character in the string is position 1. Example : substr('Bengaluru', 2, 5) result: engal
String search for substring and replace it with replacestring. If substring is not found, the string is not changed. Example : REPLACE('bengaluru','b','Z') result : Zengaluru
Returns the rightmost character from the string. Example: substr('bengaluru', (length('bengaluru')+1) - 4,length('bengaluru')) result: luru
Removes trailing whitespace from string.Example : RTRIM('Bengaluru ') result:Bengaluru
Returns a string consisting of space characters. Example:space(6) -" "
It removes leading and trailing whitespace from string. Example: TRIM(' Bengaluru ') result:Bengaluru
Converts all characters in a string to uppercase. Example: UPPER('bengaluru') result: BENGALURU.
It returns the absolute value of a number. Example: abs(-24)Result: 24
Returns the arc cosine of number. Example: acos(0.25) result: 1.318116071652818
Returns the arc sine of number. Example: asin(0.25) result: 0.25268025514207865
Returns the arc tangent of number. Example: atan(0.25) result: 0.24497866312686414
Returns the arc tangent of given number. Example: atan2(0.50,1) result: 0.4636476090008061
Displays a value rounded to a certain number of decimal places. Example: round(34.4158,2) result: 34.42
Returns number rounded up to the nearest integer. Example: ceil(0.25) result: 1
Returns the cosine of number. Example: cos(0.25) result: 0.9689124217106447
Returns the cotangent of an angle. Specify the angle in radians. Example: cot(0.25) result: 3.9163173646459399
Converts angle number in radians to degrees. Example: degrees(0.25) result: 14.32394487827058
Returns the integer part of a division operation. Example: div(5,10) result: 2
Returns the constant Pi. Example: pi() result: 3.14159
Returns Eulerâ€™s number raised to the power of the given number. Example: exp(2) result: 7.389
Returns number rounded down to the nearest number. Example: floor(3.1415) result: 3
Returns the natural logarithm of number. Example: ln(2) result: 0.6931471805599453

log() function is used to return the base 10 logarithm of a given number or logarithm of a number for a particular base, as specified in the argument. Example: log(10,4567687) result: 6.65969633629949
Returns the largest of the provided values. Example: greatest(4,13) result: 13
Returns the smallest of the provided values. Example: least(13,4) result: 4
Returns the signum function of number, that is: 0 if the argument is 0, 1 if the argument is greater than 0, -1 if the argument is less than 0. Example: sign(0.5) result: 1.
Returns the sine of number. Example: sin(0.25) result: 0.24740395925452294
Displays the value of a number raised to the power of another number. Example: power(4,2) result: 16
Converts the value of a number from degrees to radians. Example : radians(4) result : 0.06981317007977318
Displays the square root of a non-negative number. Example: sqrt(5) result: 2.23606797749979
It displays the square of a given number. Example: square(4) result: 16
Returns the tangent of number. Example: tan(0.25) result: 0.25534192122103627
Displays a number truncated to a certain number of decimal places. Example: truncate(1.289,2) result: 1.28

Returns the specified date with the specified number of interval added to the specified date_part of that date.Example:(date '2014-03-08' + Interval '2' year) result:2016-03-08 00:00:00.000000 supported units:day, month , year.

Returns the difference between date1 and date2 expressed in terms of unit. Example:(EXTRACT(year from date '2019-03-08')-EXTRACT(year from date '2014-03-08')) result: 4 supported units: day, month , year.
Returns an integer that represents the specified unit of the specified date. Example: extract(year FROM '2014-03-08') result: 2014. supported unit:YEAR,MONTH,DAY
Truncates the specified date to the accuracy specified by the unit. Example:trunc(to_date(date '2014-03-08'), 'DD') result: 2014-03-08 00:00:00.000000. supported unit:YEAR:YY, MONTH:MM, DAY:DD.

function.signature: (case when length(${year}) <> 0 OR length(${month}) <> 0 OR length(${day}) <> 0 then (to_date(${year} ||to_char (${month},'09') || to_char(${day},'09'),'YYYYMMDD')) else null end)
function.description: Returns a date for given year, month and year values. Example: case when length('2018') greaterthanlessthan 0 OR length('11') greaterthanlessthan 0 OR length('09') greaterthanlessthan 0 then to_date('2018' || to_char('11','09') || to_char('09','09') , 'YYYYMMDD') result: 2018-11-09 00:00:00.000000.Note : Replace greaterthanlessthan with greaterthanlessthan symbol
Displays Current date.

Returns the specified date with the specified number of interval added to the specified date_part of that date.Example:(date '2014-03-08' + Interval '2' year) result:2016-03-08 00:00:00.000000 supported units:hour,minute,second,day , month , year.

Returns the difference between datetime and datetime2 expressed in terms of unit. Example:EXTRACT(year from date '2019-03-08'),EXTRACT(year from date '2014-03-08') result: 4 supported units: second, minute , hour , day , month , year.

Returns an integer that represents the specified datepart of the specified date. Example: extract(year FROM timestamp '2014-03-08 12:11:20') result: 2014. supported date_part:YEAR, QUARTER, MONTH , DAY, year_month

Truncates the specified date to the accuracy specified by the unit. Example:trunc(to_timestamp(timestamp '2014-03-08 12:25:10'), 'DD') result: 2014-03-08 00:00:00.000000. supported formats:SYYYY, YYYY, YEAR, SYEAR, YYY, YY, Y, IYYY, IY, I, Q, MONTH, MON, MM, RM,WW,IW,W,DDD, DD, J,DAY, DY, D,HH, HH12, HH24,MI.
Returns day of the month for date/datetime.Example: extract(day from timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00') result: 8
Retruns the name of the week day for date/dateTime. Example: TRIM(TO_CHAR(timestamp '2019-07-24 12:25:10', 'DAY')) result: 'WEDNESDAY'
Returns the ISO day of the week for date/datetime. The value ranges from 1 (SUNDAY) to 7 (SATURDAY). Example: TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:00:00','D') result: 7

Return a TIMESTAMP format as a string.Example: TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'YYYY/MM/DD HH:MI:SS') result:2019/07/20 09:10:20. Example2 : TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'YYYY') result:2019. Example3 : TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'YYYY-MM') result:2019-07.
Returns HOUR from datetime.Example: extract(HOUR from TIMESTAMP '2014-03-08 09:00:00') result: 9

function.signature: (case when length(${year}) <> 0 or length(${month}) <> 0 or length(${day}) <> 0 or length(${hour}) <> 0 or length(${minute}) <> 0 or length(${second}) <> 0 then (to_timestamp(${year} || to_char(${month},'09') || to_char(${day},'09') || to_char(${hour},'09') || to_char(${minute},'09') || to_char(${second},'09'),'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS' )) else null end)
function.description: Returns a datetime that combines a date and time. Example:(case when length('2019') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('08') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('09') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('10') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('30') lessthangreaterthan 0 or length('45') lessthangreaterthan 0 then (to_timestamp('2019' || to_char('08','09') || to_char('09','09') || to_char('10','09') || to_char('30','09') || to_char('45','09'),'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS' )) else null end) Result:2019-08-09 10:30:45.000000 Note:replace lessthangreaterthan with symbol.

Returns the millisecond for second of the time. Example: TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20.234', 'FF') result: 234000000 NOTE:this function should be applied on timestamp columns/values only other wise an Exception will be thrown as "date format not recognized".
Returns MINUTES from datetime.Example: TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'MI') result: 10
Returns MONTH from date/datetime.Example: extract(MONTH from TIMESTAMP '2014-03-08 09:00:00') result: 3
Returns MONTHNAME from date/datetime.Example: TRIM(TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2014-03-08 09:00:00', 'MONTH')) result: 'MARCH'
Displays Current date and time.
Takes a string as input and displays a timestamp. Example.to_date('2014-03-08 09:00:00','YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS')Example:2014-03-08 09:00:00.000000
Returns the quarter of the year for date/dateTime. Example: to_char(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00')result:1
Returns SECONDS from datetime.Example: TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP '2019-07-20 09:10:20', 'SS') result: 20
Returns the ISO week of the year for date/dateTime. The value ranges from 1 to 53 or 1 to 52. Example: to_char(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00') result: 10
Returns YEAR from date/datetime.Example: extract(YEAR from TIMESTAMP '2014-03-08 09:00:00') result: 2014
Cast function converts one datatype to another Example1 : CAST( '2019-03-22 17:34:03.000' AS varchar) Example2 : CAST(65 AS varchar2(50)).
Converts value to char type. Example: to_char('2015-01-01') result:2015-01-01
Converts value to char type. Example: to_char('2015-01-01') result:2015-01-01

functions.function:
sql.typeConversion.todateTO_DATE('2019-11-02','YYYY-MM-DD') TODATE TO_DATE(${column}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
Converts value to DATE type. (Supported range is from "1000-01-01" to "9999-12-31").Example: TO_DATE('2019-11-02','YYYY-MM-DD') RESULTS: 2019-11-02 00:00:00.000000 NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing

function.description: Converts value to DATE type. (Supported range is from "1000-01-01" to "9999-12-31").Example: TO_TIMESTAMP('2019-09-02 12:22:32','YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS.FF')) RESULTS: 2019-09-02 12:22:32.000000.NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing
Converts value to number/decimal type based up on the provided value. Example:to_number('123') Result:123, to_number(123.3) result:123.3
Converts value to number/decimal type based up on the provided value. Example:to_number('123') Result:123, to_number(123.3) result:123.3
The MOD function divides the first argument by the second argument and returns the remainder.Eg: MOD(20,3) result:2
This function returns the first weekday that is greater than a date.
This function returns the first weekday that is greater than a date.
This function returns age difference between two dates.
Displays last day of the month that contains date.
REGEXP_COUNT function counts the number of times that a pattern occurs in a string.Eg: REGEXP_COUNT ('Google is a great resource', 'g', 1)Result: 2
Convert the first letter of each word to uppercase and the rest to lowercase. Words are sequences of alphanumeric characters separated by non-alphanumeric characters.
Displays the location of a substring in a string based on the given position and appearence.
It allow to substitute a value when a null value encountered. Eg:nvl('Honey Badger','is Null') Result:'Honey Badger',nvl(null ,'is Null') Result:'is Null'
Converts the date to string
Converts the number to string
Converts the dateTime to string
Converts the time to string
